moves.4. b4: Now this is called Evans Gambit.white sacrifices a flank pawn for rapid development and a powerful center.
moves.5... Ba5 6. d4 exd4 7. O-O dxc3 8. Qb3: Evans gambit  Paulsen variation.although white is down with 3 pawns, he has a very strong game.
moves.8... Qe7 9. Nxc3 Bxc3 10. Qxc3 Qf6 11. e: untill now this follows Gameknot database.
moves.15... Be6 16. Rae1 Nh6: 16....Nh6?? black has a very dangerous position and should move his queen (may be to d8, not f6 because of 17.Bxd6 that will lead to easy game for white).
moves.17. Re5xe6: 17.Rxe6!!! here black resigned because his queen will be eaten and white will be ,at least, up with 5 pawns and has a very strong position.let's see how would black continue.
moves.17... fxe6 18. Rxe6 Qxe6 19. Bxe6: now there is no hope for black. White's pair of bishops and queen can't be stopped.

opening: Evans gambit (C52), compromised defence, Paulsen variation
